claim: In the U.K., you can protect yourself against claims of copyright infringement by not making any money off the copyrighted work.

supporting.text: Copyright infringement in the U.K. is not contingent on financial gain; unauthorized use of copyrighted material can still lead to legal action regardless of profit.

attacks.text: Copyright infringement in the U.K. is not contingent on financial gain; unauthorized use of copyrighted material can still lead to legal action regardless of profit.
Non-commercial use may qualify as fair dealing under U.K. law, potentially exempting it from copyright infringement claims.
Fair dealing exceptions are limited and narrowly defined, often requiring transformative use or specific purposes like research or criticism.
Some copyright holders may choose not to pursue legal action against non-commercial infringements due to cost or public relations concerns.
Copyright holders are increasingly using automated takedown systems that target all infringements regardless of commercial intent.

supporting.text: The U.K. Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988 protects the rights of creators, and infringement occurs when their work is used without permission, irrespective of monetary benefit.

attacks.text: The U.K. Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988 protects the rights of creators, and infringement occurs when their work is used without permission, irrespective of monetary benefit.
